Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.chat

Class Chat

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.events.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.model.chat.Chat
public class Chat extends Observable
The Chat class allows users to communicate with each other through an in-game text chat.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chat

      public Chat()
      Constructs a Chat object.

  • Method Details

    • getMessagesChat

      public List<ChatMessage> getMessagesChat(String nick1, String nick2)
      Retrieves the list of messages between two players.
      Parameters:
      nick1 - the first player's nickname
      nick2 - the second player's nickname
      Returns:
      the list of messages between the two players (or the public chat, if either of the two players is null)
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the pair of players is not found in the messages map

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(Player sender, Player receiver, String message_text)
      Sends a message from one player to another.
      Parameters:
      sender - the player sending the message
      receiver - the player receiving the message
      message_text - the text of the message
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the pair of players is not found in the messages map

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(Player sender, Player receiver, String message_text, javafx.scene.paint.Color displayColor)
      Sends a message from one player to another.
      Parameters:
      sender - the player sending the message
      receiver - the player receiving the message
      message_text - the text of the message
      displayColor - the color that needs to be used to display the message
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the pair of players is not found in the messages map

    • appendMessage

      public void appendMessage(ChatMessage message, String nick1, String nick2)
      Client side method to append messages to the local chat. Server shouldn't use this method, because it won't update the clients' views. If either of the provided nicknames is null, the message will be considered public.
      Parameters:
      message - the ChatMessage that contains the message information
      nick1 - the nickname of the first player
      nick2 - the nickname of the second player
